definition: to jump/to hop/to skip over/to bounce/to palpitate

sentences.english: Acceleration means studying material that is part of the standard curriculum for older students.
sentences.chinese: 跳級意味學習高年級學生標準課程的部分內容。

sentences.english: The parents want their child to skip to the second grade.
sentences.chinese: 這家父母希望他們孩子能跳級到二年級。

sentences.english: Very few talented children may jump grades, or choose home education.
sentences.chinese: 超常兒童很難跳級，或接受私塾教育。

sentences.english: And they have college credit from passing Advanced Placement tests in high school.
sentences.chinese: 同時他們從通過高中的跳級考試來獲得大學學分。

sentences.english: Misbehavior in the classroom can sometimes indicate that grade-skipping could be in order.
sentences.chinese: 這些被認爲是行爲不端的孩子有時會被建議跳級。

sentences.english: A. P. credits can mean fewer required classes.
sentences.chinese: 跳級證書意味着需要更少的學時。

definition: lit. to enter by the back door/fig. to gain influence by pull or unofficial channels/back door or under the counter connections
International Mathematical Olympiad (IMO)/abbr. for 國際奧林匹克數學競賽|国际奥林匹克数学竞赛[Guo2 ji4 Ao4 lin2 pi3 ke4 Shu4 xue2 Jing4 sai4]
lit. to fall behind Sun Shan 孫山|孙山[Sun1 Shan1] (who came last in the imperial examination) (idiom)/fig. to fail an exam/to fall behind (in a competition)
Ruyuan Yao Autonomous County in Shaoguan 韶關|韶关[Shao2 guan1], Guangdong
to repeat a year in school
excelling both in morals and studies (idiom); top marks for studies and for behavior (at school)/a paragon of virtue and learning
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
